page.title: 14WATCHFIELD-WINDMILL
page.content: WATCHFIELD IS A SMALL HAMLET TO THE EAST OF HIGHBRIDGE ON THE B3139 ROAD TO WELLS.IT HAS BEEN A SETTLEMENT FOR OVER A THOUSAND YEARS. IN THE GARDEN OF ONE OF THE HOUSES IS A STONE BUILT WINDMILL,WITHOUT SAILS. OVER THE YEARS THE SITE HAS HAD A VARIETY OF USES BUT IT IS HOW THE HOME OF THE MR & MRS BRUCE AND IS A SMALL WOOD WORKING BUSINESS. FROM FELLING THE TREES TO THE FINISH GOODS,ONE MAN ONLY IS INVOLVED.THE TREES ARE FELLED,CUT AND TRANSPORTED TO WINDMILL HOUSE WHERE THEY ARE ALLOWED TO WEATHER.THE TIMBER IS THEN CONVERTED INTO A WIDE RANGE OF GOODS;DRESSERS,TABLES,STOOLS,PLATTERS, LAMPS ETC. GOODS ARE SOLD FROM THE SITE AND ADVERTISING IS MAINLY BY PERSONAL RECOMMENDATION.
